forecast.name: Today
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Sunny then Chance Rain And Snow Showers
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain and snow showers after 1pm. Mostly sunny. High near 45, with temperatures falling to around 35 in the afternoon. West wind 8 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 39 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 13. West wind 14 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 41 mph.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Boston, a muted tapestry of clouds hangs low, whispering hints of the chill that lingers in the air. The sky, draped in soft gray, offers a glimpse of what the day holds: a dance of fleeting rain and snow showers likely to begin after noon. With temperatures edging towards a cool 45 degrees and gradually giving way to a brisker 35, an invigorating west wind makes its presence felt, urging one to bundle up against its sharp embrace. The promise of sunshine lies ahead, but it’s tempered by the brisk gusts that threaten to remind you of winter’s lingering kiss.

Amidst this chilly embrace, it's wise to don layers—perhaps a well-fitted coat to shield against the elements, accompanied by a scarf and a sturdy pair of gloves to fend off the bite of the wind. An afternoon stroll could be invigorating, especially if one finds a cozy café to retreat to afterward—a cup of something warm in hand as the sky shifts and clouds play their endless game of hide and seek. The cooler evening will creep in swiftly, so plan accordingly to ensure warmth as you go about your evening. In these wintry months, there is beauty to be found in the edges of cold; embrace it in your own way as Boston quietly speaks in shades of gray.
